claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.

supporting_snippets.quote: Each 0.5 mL dose of Flublok contains 45 mcg HA of each of the following 3 influenza virus strains
supporting_snippets.relevance_explanation: This quote specifies the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content per strain in Flublok, which is 45 mcg per strain.

supporting_snippets.quote: Flublok is standardized according to United States Public Health Service (USPHS) requirements for the 2024-2025 influenza season and contains 135 mcg of recombinant hemagglutinin (HA) per 0.5 mL dose, with 45 mcg HA of each of the following 3 influenza virus strains
supporting_snippets.relevance_explanation: This quote confirms the total HA content in Flublok (135 mcg per dose, 45 mcg per strain), which is three times the standard 15 mcg per strain in standard-dose flu vaccines.

supporting_snippets.quote: Comparative immunogenicity of recombinant influenza hemagglutinin (rHA) and trivalent inactivated vaccines (TIVs) among persons ≥65 years old. Vaccine. 2009, Vol. 28, pp. 379-385.
supporting_snippets.relevance_explanation: This reference to a clinical study directly compares the immunogenicity of Flublok (which contains 3x the HA content) to standard-dose inactivated vaccines, supporting the claim that higher HA content is linked to greater immunogenicity.
